issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Tooling: scons: TI_DEBUG environment variable is ignored on Windows 7

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Correct ASSERT statement in javaObject.cpp.
Testing steps:
1. In terminal, type 'export TI_DEBUG=1'
2. Run scons to see if it builds successfully.
fields.summary: Android: Correct ASSERT statement in javaObject.cpp

comments.body:
Closing bug. Verified fix on:

version=2.0.0
module_apiversion=2
timestamp=03/22/12 09:33
githash=51cc9dc
OS: Lion (10.7.2)

Fixed on Snow Leopard.

version=2.0.0
module_apiversion=2
timestamp=03/22/12 13:40
githash=51cc9dc

Devices Tested: Droid3 2.3.4

Behavior:

Able to scons with TI_DEBUG=1.
Able to run new project using scons SDK.
Extra debug logs appear when app is run (i.e., V-logs for every tap event).

Need to test on Windows 7 (re-opening issue).

Able to scons on Windows 7, but there are no extra debug logs at runtime.

Tried setting global environment variable TI_DEBUG to 1,
tried console 'set TI_DEBUG=1'.

version=2.0.0
module_apiversion=2
timestamp=03/22/12 13:40
githash=51cc9dc

Devices Tested: Droid3 2.3.4

Behavior:

Able to scons with TI_DEBUG=1.
Able to run new project using scons SDK.

Unexpected: Extra debug logs do not appear when app is run (i.e., V-logs for every tap event).

Closing this issue.

Will open a new issue for the Windows 7 TI_DEBUG support. 

TI_DEBUG is for internal use.
